pageProps.content:
Experience

Set in beautiful gardens in a colonial-style shopping village called Perry’s Bridge Trading Post, you will find a country-style hotel that offers an ideal base from which to explore South Africa’s Lowveld region.
Perrys’ Bridge Hollow is situated just outside the town of Hazyview & provides a comfortable night’s rest for guests en-route to the world-renowned Kruger National Park.
The popular Panorama Route includes the renowned God’s Window look-out point, Blyde River Canyon, the interesting town of Pilgrim’s Rest, Mac Mac Waterfalls & Bourkes Luck Potholes, along with many other scenic stops.
With spacious cottages, warm hospitality & an outstanding setting, this boutique hotel is a great choice for families looking for a central base to the region’s activities & attractions.

Stay

Perry’s Bridge Hollow offers 31 deluxe rooms & 3 family suites, all equipped with air-conditioning & an en-suite bathroom.
The sophisticated, spacious deluxe rooms are set in beautiful indigenous gardens & feature private patios as well as indoor & outdoor showers. In addition, each family suite also includes a lounge area as well as a king bed, single bed & sleeper sofa for the kids.
Lodge facilities include a sparkling swimming pool, wellness spa, gym, bar & restaurant.

Activities

The Panorama Route offers a wide selection of activities & attractions.
Scenic tours are usually first on the list, so guests can experience some of the area’s most beautiful sites, including waterfalls, canyons & quaint towns.
Elephant interactions at the nearby Elephant Whispers Centre is a bucket list experience that should not be missed. Other exciting activities include zip lining, golf & game drives.
Kids will have fun at the Perry’s Bridge Reptile Park & playground.
